text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Monastir | native_name = المنستير | native_name_lang = ar | other_name = | type = Governorate | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_shield = | shield_alt = | image_map = Monastir in Tunisia.svg | map_alt = | map_caption = Map of Tunisia with Monastir highlighted | coordinates = | coor_pinpoint = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Tunisia | established_title = Created | established_date = June 5, 1974 | seat_type = Capital | seat = Monastir | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = Taïeb Nefzi (2014) | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 1019 | area_rank = Ranked 21st of 24 | area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 548828 | population_as_of = 2014 | population_rank = Ranked 8th of 24 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | population_note = | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +01 | postal_code_type = Postal prefix | postal_code = 5xxx | area_code_type = Calling code | area_code = | iso_code = TN-52 | website = | footnotes = }} Monastir Governorate ( ) is one of the twenty-four governorates of Tunisia. It is in the northeastern part of the country. It covers an area of 1,019 km². As of the 2014 census, 548,828 people lived there. Census 2014 (National Institute of Statistics) The capital is Monastir. == References == Category:1974 establishments in Tunisia Category:Governorates of Tunisia
title: Monastir Governorate
